title: Question 6
prompt: The United States allows voting rights to all residents over the age of 18, excluding only foreign nationals who have not qualified for citizenship. Based on the information in the table, which statement is true about voting in the United States?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: To answer this question, you must determine what causes voting rights to be more or less democratic. The table notes that in a democracy, decisions are made by people through voting. Sparta also had voting, but only for a few elite citizens. Since it is not considered a democracy, the more people can vote, the more democratic voting is. Since Athens had slaves who could not vote and did not allow women to vote, the United States allows a greater proportion of its population to vote. Voting rights in the United States are more democratic than in Athens.
